channel.title: Today I Learned on rowstu.net
channel.description: Recent content in Today I Learned on rowstu.net

item.title: Nextcloud autostart
item.description:
The Linux Nextcloud client now autostarts as part of the D-BUS Service. So even if you exit the client or kill the processes it restarts. To prevent this do the following:

mkdir -p ~/.local/share/dbus-1/services/
cat <<EOF > ~/.local/share/dbus-1/services/com.nextcloudgmbh.Nextcloud.service
[D-BUS Service]
Name=com.nextcloudgmbh.Nextcloud
Exec=/bin/false
EOF

This creates a D-BUS override. Remember to remove it when you want to have the client autostart through D-BUS.

Then kill the nextcloud processes with:

killall nextcloud

You can see for yourself here:

item.title: Windows Systeminfo
item.description:
TIL three things, Windows has a comprehensive systeminfo[0] command, and also because I have WSL installed I have access to the grep command. You can also pipe[1] commands:

C:\Users\me>systeminfo | grep -i "boot time"
System Boot Time: 20/11/2024, 20:36:53

Searching around it looks like the correct PowerShell way to do this is with Select-String

PS C:\Users\me> systeminfo.exe | Select-String "Boot Time"

System Boot Time: 20/11/2024, 20:36:53

[0] systeminfo.exe was introduced as part of Windows XP
